message:
The global veneur collector in staging appears to be down. The way to fix this problem is to ssh into {{ host.name }} and do this as root:

# sudo sv start veneur
# tail -f /var/log/veneur/current

Sometimes the veneur process will be running but unable to bind to its port (8126) because of dogstatsd. The veneur agent will keep spewing an error message to the logs about the port being in use if dogstatsd is running. We disable dogstatsd by adding a line to /etc/dd-agent/datadog.conf:

use_dogstatsd: no

Sometimes dogstatsd gets started up for various bad reasons. If the datadog config file has that line to disable dogstatsd and ps shows dogstatsd is running, then the following should fix that problem (as root):

# /etc/init.d/datadog restart

After that, start up the veneur agent with 

# sv start veneur

If the agent won't start, or the logs show other problems after that, please contact the SKYNET team to fix the problem.

Notify: @ksprochi@sonatype.com @slack-skynet-alerts
name: AWS: HDS Staging Global Veneur Collector diminished capacity

message:
The global veneur collector in production appears to be down. The way to fix this problem is to ssh into {{ host.name }} and do this as root:

# sudo sv start veneur
# tail -f /var/log/veneur/current

Sometimes the veneur process will be running but unable to bind to its port (8126) because of dogstatsd. The veneur agent will keep spewing an error message to the logs about the port being in use if dogstatsd is running. We disable dogstatsd by adding a line to /etc/dd-agent/datadog.conf:

use_dogstatsd: no

Sometimes dogstatsd gets started up for various bad reasons. If the datadog config file has that line to disable dogstatsd and ps shows dogstatsd is running, then the following should fix that problem (as root):

# /etc/init.d/datadog restart

After that, start up the veneur agent with 

# sv start veneur

If the agent won't start, or the logs show other problems after that, please contact the SKYNET team to fix the problem.

Notify: @ksprochi@sonatype.com
name: AWS: HDS Production Global Veneur Collector diminished capacity

message:
{{#is_alert}}@ksprochi@sonatype.com @slack-skynet-critical-alert @slack-ops-alerts  @insight-operations@sonatype.com @pagerduty 
# P1 Outage 
*P1 Outage*

There are *no* healthy targets in target group {{target_group.name}}

HDS is out of service and needs immediate attention!

scan processor servers: clmscan01a/clmscan01b/idescan01a/rhcscan01a/rhcscan01b

Things to look at:

1. ssh into the web workers (clmweb01a/clmweb01b) and see if the ds-web-worker process is running. if not, sudo sv start ds-web-worker and look at /var/log/ds-web-worker/ds-web-worker.log to see if there are any errors
2. ssh into the scan processor server and see if the scan-processor java process is running (or ide-scan process if it's the ide scan server). If the service isn't running then sv start scan-processor (or sv start ide-scan)     
3. Check the logs in /var/log/scan-processor (or /var/log/ide-scan) for errors.
4. Database connections may have been all used up. There will be log messages indicating db connectivity failures.
 
{{/is_alert}}

{{#is_warning}}@slack-skynet-alerts 
There is at least one unhealthy target in target group {{target_group.name}}

scan processor servers: clmscan01a/clmscan01b/idescan01a/rhcscan01a/rhcscan01b

Things to look at:

1. ssh into the web workers (clmweb01a/clmweb01b) and see if the ds-web-worker process is running. if not, sudo sv start ds-web-worker and look at /var/log/ds-web-worker/ds-web-worker.log to see if there are any errors
2. ssh into the scan processor server and see if the scan-processor java process is running (or ide-scan process if it's the ide scan server). If the service isn't running then sv start scan-processor (or sv start ide-scan)     
3. Check the logs in /var/log/scan-processor (or /var/log/ide-scan) for errors.
4. Database connections may have been all used up. There will be log messages indicating db connectivity failures.
{{/is_warning}}

{{#is_alert_recovery}}@ksprochi@sonatype.com @slack-skynet-critical-alert @slack-ops-alerts   @insight-operations@sonatype.com @pagerduty
All targets in target group {{target_group.name}} are now healthy.
{{/is_alert_recovery}}

{{#is_warning_recovery}}@slack-skynet-alerts
All targets in target group {{target_group.name}} are now healthy.
{{/is_warning_recovery}}
